review-title: Mr. Director think it is magnificent but I think it's a piece of crap :o
Comments: Sensor board should've banned the movie not for how offensive it is, rather how primitive purposeless and unengaging it is. The movie is dull and does not have any flavor and by the end of the movie it makes you think staring at a wall for the movie length might've been better. I do wonder how did they even manage to make a three and a half hour movie from a subjectless script.The movie might be recognised only for the performance by Ranbir Kapoor and i have to say there was more room for improvement had the character been written more meticulously. Father was the worst part of the movie hands down, it was like having a statue instead, since there is absolutely no contribution to the plot else than his existence. No offense to the actor playing the role since the character has been written this way.This pathetic role was only succeeded by the wife. Oh man, I believe wife did have a lot of impact on the movie. Or should I say could have. The actress portrayed the wife's role with such expressions that she reminds you of the stickman from the memes. The antagonist is hailed all over the internet, but I'd say he would've been amazing had he been on screen for a little more time and spoke a little more.It's a failed attempt at American psycho and fightclub.Lack of depth and intensity makes the character fall short of Patrick Bateman, lack of purpose, origin story and emotion proves the character falls short of being Rocky from KGF-1(KGF-2 was not a good movie).All the hate goes to the script writer, and the director. The only scene which was relevant to the movie was the last one where the lead actor confronts his father(although the credit scrolls is a better scene). The whole movie is absolute garbage that would make you loathe the art of movie making. There ain't any scene that moves you and the movie lacks proper romance, emotions don't make you feel a thing, comedy is vulgar, cheap and not funny.I hope the director makes time from writing awful scripts to go see a shrink and get some help. This is not just referring him as a misogynist but as person who lacks good thoughts and good ideas. And Mr. Delusional high-level testosterone, poetry is not for weak men, and poems do not talk about "I'll bring the moon for you" since they are not as shallow as your movie. Even if you knew a little about poetry you wouldn't have had made a bad movie. Poetry is used to eloquently express how a person feels so that it doesn't not become an infestation.This review does not allude the length of sexism portrayed in the movie. I wonder how long writing about that'll go.A pathetic, cheap, unengaging, brain-dead, poetry-less movie.
Label: negative

review-title: "Bloodstains of Discontent: A Disastrous Dive into Family Drama and Vengeful Chaos in 'Animal Movie'"
Comments: Movie attempts to explore the complex dynamics of a strained father-son relationship, but falls short with a poorly executed plot. The narrative takes a dark turn as the protagonist's quest for revenge descends into an unrealistic and disturbing bloodbath. The excessive violence overshadows any potential emotional depth, resulting in a jarring and unsatisfying viewing experience. 1 out of 10 for a storyline that loses its grip on reality and fails to deliver a meaningful exploration of family dynamics."Bloodstains of Discontent: A Disastrous Dive into Family Drama and Vengeful Chaos in 'Animal Movie'"
Label: negative

review-title: THIS MOVIE IS NOT FOR THE FAINT HEARTED
Comments: The movie has a roller coaster of emotions going on. Despite this dad, son saga being about 3.5hrs long it's exceptionally gripping. If you're looking for reality, or relatability, this movie isn't for you. Most aspects are fictional and should not be taken as an example of a toxic lifestyle etc - alike Kabir Singh.If you love action movies, this movie will not disappoint you - with its great scene choreograph and amazing background score and not to mention the outstanding acting. Ranbir, throughout was a great fit for this role and has completely nailed the character. Rashmika and Anil Kapoor also do not fail to impress you. And on top of this Bobby Deol - the most unexpected actor has truly made a comeback with his scenes. One thing I would've wished for would be to give him more screen time - because his character and acting could've have shone more.You might feel the movie a little long but I think Sandeep - the director is looking to build a much larger movie with this concept hence the lengthy movie.Overall, if you're faint hearted and believe everything can become toxic then this movie isn't for you *period* If you love action, romance and great acting and would like to enjoy your evening then please do not miss this banger!
Label: positive

review-title: Provocative elements seemed aimed at shock value rather than enhancing the story
Comments: Despite its box office success, "Animal" has been a polarizing film, drawing criticism for its depiction of toxic masculinity and glorification of violence. Critics have pointed out that the film, while attempting to weave a complex narrative around familial bonds and revenge, often indulges in excessive brutality and a problematic portrayal of its characters, overshadowing its cinematic merits. The mixed reviews highlight a divide between the film's commercial achievements and its reception in critical circles.Upon viewing "Animal," the film's portrayal of edginess felt more contrived than genuine, diminishing any deep narrative connection. The introduction of provocative elements seemed aimed at shock value rather than enhancing the story, leading to a fragmented viewing experience. This superficial approach, coupled with the use of controversial imagery, left me pondering the film's ultimate purpose and creative direction. The absence of genuine thematic exploration resulted in an experience that seemed devoid of substance and coherence, raising questions about the effectiveness of its narrative strategies.
Label: negative

review-title: Could have been a super movie
Comments: Could have been a super movie, but few stupid actions scenes with no sense just ruined it. On the other hand, direction was great (plenty of tiny special details), the characters were unique and touching (also the actors did a good job there) and the music was awesome. Storyline was ok, but could have been better, it seems that after intermission a complete different movie starts. Still, the good directing made this movie way beyond average bollywood movie. Finally a bollywood movie that breaks with the usual love story and despite some brainless action scenes, shows some real life violence in it.
Label: negative
